And what was the education system like in the UK compared to your time in school in Jamaica?
Well, I must admit, the education in Jamaica was good.
But UK was, I would say, slightly better.
I'm going to give you the reason why.
Because in Jamaica, you know what I mean, in your class,
English, maths, any other subject you go through, history, geography, science,
there's only one teacher.
You don't leave from one class and go to another class and go to another class.
You've got the same teacher that teaches you everything.
So it took me a while to work it out.
So when you start moving up to another class,
the same teacher does everything.
And everything the teachers do, some of them have different ways of bringing it out to you.
So it makes you, you know what I mean, you can be confused at times, if I speak the truth.
It makes you confused at times because you don't know what's what from what's not.
Because every one of them have a different way of teaching it.
But when I come over and go back to school, it's not like that.
To me, the way they do it in England wasn't proper. Why?
This man is like maths, this one is like English, science, history, and things like that.
So everybody teaches one subject, if you know what I mean.
And he's specializing in that one subject, not specializing in about ten others.
One subject. So he can more or less recite that subject all the way through.
And I find that's a better idea of teaching.
Even when I go back to Jamaica on holiday, I go back to school,
and I actually go and see some of the class teachers and I told them, I said,
it's all wrong what you're doing, one teacher shouldn't be doing that.
Because one teacher don't know everything.
If you specialize in English, that's what you should be teaching.
If you specialize in maths, that's what you should be teaching.
If you specialize in geometry, that's what you should be teaching.
And not one teacher doing all that, you see.
And I said, I think now at the moment things are slightly different now in Jamaica with the teaching.
But as I said, I enjoy it, you know what I mean.
